item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A thing is not necessarily true because a man dies for it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If you are not long, I will wait for you all my life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Indeed I have always been of the opinion that hard work is simply the refuge of people who have nothing to do." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Moderation is a fatal thing. Nothing succeeds like excess." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tika add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. (Mr. Dumby, Act III)" -- Oscar Wilde
